description: Consider setting the environment variable GVIM_ENABLE_WAYLAND=1 using Flatseal to enable Wayland support

To open in the terminal, use

flatpak run org.vim.Vim
summary: useful if you are using Fedora SilverBlue

description: The learning curve may be a bit steep, but it is worth it.
summary: Still the most used utility on my machines

description: GVIM is a particularly useful enhancement as it delivers a functional, approachable GUI text editor with all the power and flexibility of vi while still enabling a full text-console implementation.
summary: Puts the power of vi in a GUI -- what's not to like?!

description: or with an alias vim="flatpak run org.vim.Vim"
summary: loads from the commandline with: flatpak run org.vim.Vim

description:
Provides both a GTK and CLI version, and is frequently updated. For those looking to use this on the CLI;

For BASH add this line to your .bashrc and logout/login:
alias vim="flatpak run org.vim.Vim" 

For fish, just run this once:
alias --save vim="flatpak run org.vim.Vim"

Note these commands are cAsE-sEnSiTiVe, the capital V needs to be there!
insupportable a prendre en main... mais meilleurs éditeur de texte passé une-deux semaines
summary: la prise en main est dure
